answer: The dynamical behavior of the anisotropic order parameter following a quench to the critical point is well described by the Gaussian theory for all three lattice gas models studied. In the short-time regime, the anisotropic order parameter ($O$) scales as $O \sim t^{\alpha} L_{\parallel}^{-1/2}$, where $\alpha$ is a phenomenological exponent to be determined. This behavior distinguishes between the driven lattice gases (IDLG, RDLG) and the equilibrium lattice gas (LG).
